required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Atorvastatin Versus Simvastatin In The Prevention Of Coronary Heart Disease (CHD) In Patients With Known CHD
clinical_study.official_title: Atorvastatin Compared With Simvastatin In The Prevention of CHD Morbidity And Mortality In Patients With CHD

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate whether a long-term strategy to lower LDL cholesterol with atorvastatin as much as possible will improve prognosis in CHD patients compared with a strategy reflecting current best clinical practice with simvastatin.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to of a major coronary event: 1) non-fatal acute myocardial infarction 2) coronary death 3) resuscitated cardiac arrest

secondary_outcome.measure: 1) Time to any CHD event, 2) Time to Hospitalization with primary diagnosis of CHF, 3) Time to Cerbrovascular Event, 4) Time to PAD, 5) Time to any CV event and 6) All Cause Mortality

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previous myocardial infarction
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women who are breast feeding or are pregnant

results_reference.citation: Pedersen TR, Faergeman O, Kastelein JJ, Olsson AG, Tikkanen MJ, Holme I, Larsen ML, Bendiksen FS, Lindahl C, Szarek M, Tsai J; Incremental Decrease in End Points Through Aggressive Lipid Lowering (IDEAL) Study Group. High-dose atorvastatin vs usual-dose simvastatin for secondary prevention after myocardial infarction: the IDEAL study: a randomized controlled trial. JAMA. 2005 Nov 16;294(19):2437-45. Erratum in: JAMA. 2005 Dec 28;294(24):3092.
